bibl.title: Practice Makes Perfect. P. Cotsen-Princeton 1 and the Training of Scribes in Byzantine Egypt.
bibl.publisher: Cotsen Occasional Press (Diffusion: HES De Graaf)

Preface. - Chapter 1. Of Words and Dirt: An Introduction to the Study of P. Cotsen-Princeton 1. - Chapter 2. Assessing P. Cotsen-Princeton 1. - Chapter 3. ""Unpacking"" P. Cotsen-Princeton 1: Contents and Format. - Chapter 4. Putting It All Together: Interpreting P. Cotsen-Princeton 1. - Facsimile Reproduction of P. Cotsen-Princeton 1. - References. Indexes.
bibl.seg: Scott Bucking, Practice Makes Perfect. P. Cotsen-Princeton 1 and the Training of Scribes in Byzantine Egypt.
Los Angeles, Cotsen Occasional Press (Diffusion: HES De Graaf), 2011, 8°, 264 pp., nombr. ill. n./bl. et coul., cartes, plans, 108 pll. coul. ISBN 978-0-9745168-4-4. €125.

Preface. - Chapter 1. Of Words and Dirt: An Introduction to the Study of P. Cotsen-Princeton 1. - Chapter 2. Assessing P. Cotsen-Princeton 1. - Chapter 3. ""Unpacking"" P. Cotsen-Princeton 1: Contents and Format. - Chapter 4. Putting It All Together: Interpreting P. Cotsen-Princeton 1. - Facsimile Reproduction of P. Cotsen-Princeton 1. - References. Indexes.

C.R. par Anne Boud'hors, Tyche 28 (2013) pp. 235-238. - Alain Delattre, ChrEg 87 (2012) No. 174, pp. 393-394. - Hans Förster, Journal of Coptic Studies 14 (2012) pp. 159-162. - David Frankfurter, JRA 26 (2013) pp. 929-932.
